body:
Yo guys, so I was looking at my many demotions and recently came across the best one! 

From Junior Mod:
Hey iron, not sure if you've noticed by the time you've looked at this message; but the senior staff has decided to demote you from Junior Moderator after your disgusting behavior on TeamSpeak. You have clearly broken the Code of Conduct policy 3D & 3E; which state that you are to avoid any situations that can be perceived as harassment. You've failed to show us your ability to treat everyone fairly, honestly and with integrity. 

Sorry for this notice.

Funnily enough the evidence provided for this was 1 after I was demoted. Two this: https://gyazo.com/61b0e0e21c3680a5c52da81772f39e19.png
Yep look at that, Freedom of Speech is no longer allowed.

Then, when I asked for some proper evidence. This is what I got: 
"I think we don't need evidence if we witnessed & assessed your behavior accordingly."-REDACTED
Right, that is definitely legit. Especially because the admin himself was not even there! LOL. This guy called Ambivalence_ was there. Turns out he was the one who witnessed shit. 

After all of this REDACTED had the audacity to blackmail Zac. Funnily enough their is a video of it and it is definitely still in circulation. EVEN BETTER, REDACTED is a snake. https://gyazo.com/e83843af2bdb11c7086f6f4f15ce9818 <--ambi talking with REDACTED about my demotion. :)

 Have fun.

-Salt King

replies.body:
Search it up on Google.

redact
rɪˈdakt/
verb
past tense: redacted; past participle: redacted
  1. edit (text) for publication.
    "a confidential memo which has been redacted from 25 pages to just one paragraph"
    • censor or obscure (part of a text) for legal or security purposes.
replies.body_tagged:
Search it up on Google.

redact
rɪˈdakt/
verb
past tense: redacted; past participle: redacted
  1. edit (text) for publication.
    "a confidential memo which has been redacted from 25 pages to just one paragraph"
    • censor or obscure (part of a text) for legal or security purposes.

replies.body: There are a lot of people that want to help. Doesn't mean they are good. To be a mod you need to be a leader, someone who makes their server look good, someone who can lead the staff team, someone who is helpful to players. If you want to know, I said everything in order to most important to least important. The two top things he was not. Also this was when he was Sn Mod. He raged at players that were raging at him and made himself look like a bad mod. This happened from my knowledge more than 3 times.

replies.body:
The only reason I partially enjoy avicus is the maps. They're not made for competitive play and it makes it easier to just relax and play them compared to OCN 

Then again with shitty hit-reg, constant bugs and staff that seem to have the people skills of a 4 year old trying to give a speech, I wouldn't be surprised if it dies.
